author: perama
content:
<@!486501030046203915>  I finished a prototype of the game I described. I call it gidget-gadget!

https://github.com/perama-v/gidget-gadget

Its all contained in a python script and runs from the terminal

author: perama
content:
In short, it lets you:
- add transactions to the mempool
- see basefee projections
- gauge the fee market 'context' by looking at recent blocks and mempool contents quickly

author: barnabemonnot
content: i need to play more with it, but it's such a cool idea

author: barnabemonnot
content: so when you press a number it just sends that number worth of transactions onto the pool at a really high price to make sure they are always included?

author: perama
content:
The number you press is the gas price, (e.g. press 4 for ~40gwei). 

A single press generates 150 transactions (you can changes this and other parameters in the file at the top)

author: perama
content:
The 150 tx consist of random prices in the range e.g. 40 +/-20% gwei

Their ordering is naive: A transaction only has one parameter "fee = 41", and the next block is constructed by taking n blocks, starting with the largest fee.

author: perama
content:
Mashing the numpad floods the pool, so you can the value of ``new_txs_per_keypress = 150`` to something smaller for a more refined control of upcoming tx. 
Simulation can be slowed down with ``block_time=2`` by changing to e.g., ``5`` for five second blocks.
